name: The Inn Above Tide

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You stay here for the fabulous views and convenience to in-town dining and activities, however, the hotel is sweet and nicely appointed. As we had the advantage to choose our room, we can confirm some rooms can be dark, therefore, request a room without a balcony above yours (much of the 2nd floor proved sunny). Further, the rooms are clean and comfortable, the bathtubs bordering on small swimming pool (and frankly bordering on awkward if not taking a bath). The front desk and valet were friendly, save one woman who seemed to be somewhat of a sourpuss and couldn't be bothered. Otherwise, everyone was accommodating and thoughtful, helping us with dinner suggestions and reservations (Poggio's was wonderful, although service lackluster) to finding a road less traveled as we made our way to Sonoma. The continental breakfast and wine and cheese presentation while not extraordinary, were adequate and just enough to start and end the day. Sure it would be nice if the hotel rooms were larger, bedside tables more convenient, indoor seating more comfortable … but then again that's not why you (or at least we) stay here. It's a lovely hotel, albeit not amazing. Leaving the door open and falling asleep to the waves, reading a book on your balcony with a glass of wine and the sunset over San Francisco … now that's amazing.
reviews.title: Sweet Rooms and Spectacular Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: If I hadn't been on my honeymoon I would have given it a lower rating. We stayed 3 nights and the annoyances began to build up.
reviews.title: Really 3.5 stars -- overpriced and not so cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the positives:
reviews.title: Elegant and Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view is awesome and it accounts for about 1 star. I saw two gorgeous sunsets. The continental breakfast is good with a lot of fresh fruit and delicious muffins. The coffee is great too. We enjoyed having our breakfast in bed one morning. When we needed to use our car it was retrieved promptly.
reviews.title: A Little Piece of Heaven

likes.disliked: — If you like firm pillows on the bed, bring your own from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the negatives:
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location ok Great Views too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had 5 star prices for a 3 star room. It was very over priced. 340.00 got us a great view, comfortable bed, but the room
reviews.title: The view was the hotels saving grace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: was teeny tiny and furnishings dated, bland and not elegant. at all. Web site showed rooms to be far nicer than they were. Nothing extra special We expected much more for the price. Better hotels for half the price in S.F. Comp wine and cheese and continental breaksfast was fine. The parking attendant was great but the other staff were as bland as the room.
reviews.title: Great view, good rooms.

likes.disliked: — Bathroom was nice, but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Greeting and check-in was pleasant and very helpful. My room was on the 3rd floor and had an amazing view of downtown San Francisco across the bay (as all rooms seems to have). The 3rd floor rooms don't have a balcony, but have big windows that open. I had the king superior room, which was a good sized room with a large bed. The room was very well appointed and maintained. The bed was awesome. Excellent mattress, wonderful linens, great pillows, and a nice down comforter. I slept great. One of the walls of the room was all mirrored. :-) The bathroom was very large, but did not have the same warm feel as the bedroom. The tub was large deep and clean, but not the best for showering. Great for a hot soak however. The robes were the high quality spa type robes, and the slippers were nice as well.
reviews.title: View, Luxury, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room lacked an ironing board and a coffee maker, however a small (but nice) continental breakfast was available on the main floor each day. People tended to load up and take things back to their room. For a small fee ($3) you could also have a wide selection of things delivered to your room directly as well. Why make your own coffee if someone will deliver it? :-)
reviews.title: Amazing location but the inn didn't live up to the hype!

likes.disliked: — lack of coffee maker and iron in room, room size and unwelcoming desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall, it was a great stay... and the best place I have stayed in Sausalito thus far.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: In contrast to the review below, we had an excellent trip (and I am not a hotel employee). The hotel is right on the water and is ten steps to the ferry to San Francisco. It is in downtown Sausalito -in the center of all the artist lofts and neat stores.
reviews.title: What's Not to Like?
You can believe what you read!
reviews.text: Upon our check-in we were given a "King Deluxe room". The room wasn't oversized, but had all the room that we needed. We weren't planning to stay in our room the whole time, so it was fine. My parents were able to stay in the room next to us, which was great. We could talk to them from our deck. The main window to the room was a sliding glass door that led to our deck.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed wine and cheese on our deck each afternoon. We also had breakfast on the deck each day. The only downfall we had with breakfast was the deck became warm due to the rising morning sun. One tip: there is a $3.00 delivery fee for breakfast to be delivered to your room. Minimal change and definetly worth it, but also worth mentioning since I hadn't realized until we checked out.
reviews.title: Faultless
Wonderful
reviews.text: The hotel staff was pleasant. My two cents on the reviews of the rudeness of the front desk staff: I think people need to understand that this hotel is not a large chain hotel. It is located in an artsy part of the Bay area and is not a typical "cooker cutter" resort/hotel. It is a small inn located in dowtown Sausalito. The culture is different in Sauslito. It does not serve to the masses. If you are looking for a large hotel feel, this is not your place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time and would certainly recommend it to anyone without hesitation. It was quiet, convenient and relaxing...not to mention a phenomenal view. All that a vacation should be!!
reviews.title: Outstanding View

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping did not show up on time for turn-down, and left my room unfinished when they did show up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 2nd trip in 6 months to the San Francisco and California coast. When I visited in June we stayed at the Argonaut in San Francisco. This trip my husband and myself stayed in a well known Inn in Pacific Grove for several nights and then stayed several nights in the Inn above Tide. The first night we stayed in one of the suites at $500 plus a night. The room was spacious very well appointed with a real wood burning fireplace with wood provided and kingsize bed and large jetted spa tub. The 2nd night as the suite was unavailable for more than 1 night, we stayed in a smaller room with a queen size bed at a $200 plus savings. The room while less opulent still featured a gas fireplace with the same lovely bay view and deck chairs to boot. Any way you go, breakfast in bed or no, rain or shine, the view is worth the price. This is the first time I have ever lingered until 5 minutes before the mandatory check out time just to sit and look out at the bay, take in the activity that goes on in and around the water. This is definitely the place to stay if you are planning a trip to the San Francisco bay area much better than staying in San Francisco and for the same $$. With the Golden Gate bridge and all the other activities just minutes away, The Inn above Tide will be our choice again next year.
reviews.title: In any kind of weather the view is awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable and came with European size down pillows. Except for the noise of the ferry (which is not that often and not very loud), it is unbelievably quiet. The staff was very courteous and friendly. The view is just amazing. You see the beautiful skyline of SF. They will deliver a continental breakfast to your room. We had a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Inn Above Tide for the first three nights of our honeymoon. I can honestly say I was blown away by this place!!! We stayed in a king deluxe room which to me was very roomy. We had a smaller balcony, but it did not matter. Our view was amazing just the same. When we arrived in our room they had put out a complimentary bottle of champagne because we were on our honeymoon. We spent most of our time out on the balcony when we were at the hotel because it is just so relaxing. The wine & cheese from 5-7 was great. They refreshed the wine and cheese so there was always something for you no matter what time you got there. You can bring it back to your room or you can enjoy it down there and speak to other guests. The breakfasts are out of this world!!! We had them deliver it to the room everyday (the $3 charge is for when you don't tip the guy delivering the food, I only got charged the first day when I had no cash on me). We were able to eat the delicious breakfast on the balcony watching the sunrise over the bay- it was wonderful!!! The ferry leaves from the pier right next to the hotel so it is very convienent to take a day trip into San Francisco. The staff was amazing. I never had to lift a finger while I was there (someone always to get the luggage, pull the car around, make dinner reservations, etc...). The gave us some great dinner suggestions as well. We are already planning our return trip for a future anniversary!!!
reviews.title: Perfect!!!

likes.liked: — The view, the food, the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new husband and I arrived at the hotel after our wedding, which went superbly. We were so excited to check into the hotel and enjoy each other's company. Being so elated from just getting married and having a wonderful wedding in Palo Alto a the Garden Court Hotel (a truly excellent hotel if you are looking for a 4 star experience), it would have been very hard to put us in a bad mood. However, the Inn Above Tide's staff left me in tears.
reviews.title: This Inn ruined my honeymoon!

likes.liked: — The rude staff, and the small, dirty rooms that are not at all what they look like on the inn's website.
likes.disliked: — Dont stay in Sausalito - stay in SF and take the ferry into Sausalito for a day trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we walked into the room we had been given keys to, we immediately realized it was not the room we booked several months ago (not only that but the room was quite shabby with a large stain on the carpet, scuff marks along the walls, dirt along the tile surrounding the fireplace, and terrible caulking job in the bathroom).
reviews.title: Saving Grace!

likes.disliked: — No Spa, pool or eating in facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: Maybe our expectations were too high having read some of the reviews on this site, but the Inn Above Tide didn't quite do it for us.
reviews.title: Very good but not exactly heaven...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely, the views are magnificent, the staff are competent but not exactly 'warm'. The place lacks a certain something and I can't put my finger on what it is.
reviews.title: Great view but it needs something
It was Heaven!!!!
reviews.text: One thing that future guests should be aware of is that - in spite of offering valet parking - you car may well be stored in the public lot across the way from the hotel. While this in itself is not such a big issue, I discovered our car (unaccompanied) with the keys in the ignition and the engine running 50 yards from the hotel - the valet had apparently gone to our room (on the third floor) to get our bags. Maybe there's not much in the way of car crime in Sausalito but I wouldn't have liked to have explained it to the hire company!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: The Inn Above Tide is all about location - it is spectacularly positioned on SF bay with a view of the city, the bay and surrounding islands like none other. Our 3-night stay was a mixed bag. The "suite" was not actually a suite, but a large single room with a very nice balcony. There were a lot of odd missteps - the air conditioner was a noisy wall-mounted box up near the ceiling, the door to the balcony was half-covered by a curtain that wouldn't stay pulled back & that you had to reach behind to work the door handle, the curtains on the main window did not stay closed, the whirlpool bath didn't function, the bathroom was small given the size of the room, and there were no openable windows nor a screen door to let in the wonderful outside air and sounds.
reviews.title: Amazing Views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: The furnishings were just nice, not outstanding. Breakfast and afternoon wine & cheese were very good. The staff was competent, particularly the valet/bellmen, but inconsistent when it came to knowledge of local restaurants.
reviews.title: Hotel on the Bay
A very memorable experience!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at The Inn Above Tide in May, 2005, for two nights following a San Francisco business trip. It was everything the Inn's website billed it to be... an intimate, waterside, upscale inn that fully takes advantage of its prime location to give guests a unique, enjoyable, and very memorable travel experience. Though small, our queen room was well furnished in a contemporary style, including a fireplace, and top quality bed linens and towels. The small size of the room, however, did not detract from our experience. In fact, we spent considerable time outside on our private balcony admiring the incredible views, day and night, of San Francisco across the Bay. The Inn's staff was extremely friendly and accommodating and made us feel right at home. They recommended several fine restaurants in Sausalito, all within walking distance of the Inn. We travel quite a bit and rank this inn in the top tier of hotels at which we have stayed. We'll be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: The Inn Above Tide is all about THE EXPERIENCE. The rooms are a bit small, but look at $300 a night rooms elsewhere in SF, DC, NY, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful as usual....
Great Stay
reviews.text: You go there for the VIEW which is STUNNING. PLEASE get a balcony room, it is so amazing to dine at Angelino's and come cack and watch the city light up.

reviews.title: WOW! Can't Wait to go Back
reviews.text: This is the greatest weekend splurge around. We did our 20th anniversary there and can't wait for 25!

aka: The Inn Above Tide Hotel Sausalito
